ERC20","name":"_token","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"withdrawReserve","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"author":"Alpha*","events":{"Borrow(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"emitted on borrow","params":{"borrowAmount":"the amount of borrow","borrowShares":"the amount of borrow shares which calculated from borrow amount","pool":"the address of the ERC20 token of the pool","user":"the address of the user who borrow the ERC20 token from the pool"}},"Deposit(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"emitted on deposit","params":{"depositAmount":"the amount of the ERC20 that deposit to the pool","depositShares":"the share amount of the ERC20 token which calculated from deposit amount Note: depositShares is the same as number of alphaToken","pool":"the address of the ERC20 token of the pool","user":"the address of the user who deposit the ERC20 token to the pool"}},"Liquidate(address,address,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,address)":{"details":"emitted on liquidate","params":{"collateral":"the address of the ERC20 token that liquidator received as a rewards","collateralAmount":"the amount of the collateral which calculated from liquidate amount that liquidator want to liquidate","collateralShares":"the amount of collateral shares which liquidator received from liquidation in from of alToken","liquidateAmount":"the amount of the ERC20 token that liquidator liquidate for the user","liquidateShares":"the amount of liquidate shares which calculated from liquidate amount","liquidator":"the address of the liquidator","pool":"the address of the ERC20 token which is liquidated by liquidator","user":"the address of the user who is liquidated by liquidator"}},"PoolConfigUpdated(address,address)":{"details":"emitted on update pool configuration","params":{"pool":"the address of the ERC20 token of the pool","poolConfigAddress":"the address of the updated pool's configuration contract"}},"PoolInitialized(address,address,address)":{"details":"emitted on initilize pool","params":{"alTokenAddress":"the address of the pool's alToken","pool":"the address of the ERC20 token of the pool","poolConfigAddress":"the address of the pool's configuration contract"}},"PoolInterestUpdated(address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"emitted on pool updates interest","params":{"cumulativeBorrowInterest":"the borrow interest which accumulated from last update timestamp to now","pool":"the address of the ERC20 token of the pool","totalBorrows":"the updated total borrows of the pool. increasing by the cumulative borrow interest."}},"PoolPriceOracleUpdated(address)":{"details":"emitted on set price oracle","params":{"priceOracleAddress":"the address of the price oracle"}},"Repay(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"emitted on repay","params":{"pool":"the address of the ERC20 token of the pool","repayAmount":"the amount of repay","repayShares":"the amount of repay shares which calculated from repay amount","user":"the address of the user who repay the ERC20 token to the pool"}},"ReservePercentUpdated(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"emitted on update reserve percent","params":{"newReservePercent":"the updated pool's reserve percent","previousReservePercent":"the previous pool's reserve percent"}},"ReserveWithdrawn(address,uint256,address)":{"details":"emitted on reserve withdraw","params":{"amount":"the amount to withdraw","pool":"the address of the ERC20 token of the pool","withdrawer":"the address of withdrawer"}},"Withdraw(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"emitted on withdraw alToken","params":{"pool":"the address of the ERC20 token of the pool","user":"the address of the user who withdraw the ERC20 token from the pool","withdrawAmount":"the amount of withdraw","withdrawShares":"the amount of withdraw shares which calculated from withdraw amount"}}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"borrow(address,uint256)":{"details":"borrow the ERC20 token from the pool","params":{"_amount":"the borrow amount User can call this function to borrow the ERC20 token from the pool. This function will convert the borrow amount to the borrow shares then accumulate borrow shares of this user of this ERC20 pool then set to user data on that pool state. e.g. Bob borrows 10 Hello tokens from the Hello token pool. if 1 borrow shares of Hello token equals to 5 Hello tokens then the lending contract will set Bob's borrow shares state with 2 borrow shares. Bob will receive 10 Hello tokens.","_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool that user want to borrow"}},"claimAlpha()":{"details":"claim Alpha token rewards from all ERC20 token pools and create receipt for caller"},"deposit(address,uint256)":{"details":"deposit the ERC20 token to the pool","params":{"_amount":"the deposit amount User can call this function to deposit their ERC20 token to the pool. user will receive the alToken of that ERC20 token which represent the liquidity shares of the user. Providing the liquidity will receive an interest from the the borrower as an incentive. e.g. Alice deposits 10 Hello tokens to the pool. if 1 Hello token shares equals to 2 Hello tokens then Alice will have 5 Hello token shares from 10 Hello tokens depositing. User will receive the liquidity shares in the form of alToken so Alice will have 5 alHello on her wallet for representing her shares.","_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool that user want to deposit"}},"getPool(address)":{"details":"get the pool of the ERC20 token","params":{"_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool"},"returns":{"status":"- the pool's status, alTokenAddress - the pool's alToken, poolConfigAddress - the pool's configuration contract, totalBorrows - the pool's total borrows, totalBorrowShares - the pool's total borrow shares, totalLiquidity - the pool's total liquidity, totalAvailableLiquidity - the pool's total available liquidity, lastUpdateTimestamp - the pool's last update timestamp"}},"getTotalAvailableLiquidity(address)":{"details":"get total available liquidity in the ERC20 token pool","params":{"_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool"},"returns":{"_0":"the balance of the ERC20 token in the pool"}},"getTotalLiquidity(address)":{"details":"get total liquidity of the ERC20 token pool","params":{"_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool"},"returns":{"_0":"the total liquidity on the lending pool which is the sum of total borrows and available liquidity"}},"getUserAccount(address)":{"details":"get user account details","params":{"_user":"the address of the user to get the account details return totalLiquidityBalanceBase - the value of user's total liquidity, totalCollateralBalanceBase - the value of user's total collateral, totalBorrowBalanceBase - the value of user's total borrow"}},"getUserCompoundedBorrowBalance(address,address)":{"details":"get user's compounded borrow balance of the user in the ERC20 token pool","params":{"_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool that will get the compounded borrow balance","_user":"the address of the user"},"returns":{"_0":"the compounded borrow balance of the user on the ERC20 token pool"}},"getUserCompoundedLiquidityBalance(address,address)":{"details":"get user's compounded liquidity balance of the user in the ERC20 token pool","params":{"_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool that will get the compounded liquidity balance","_user":"the account address of the user"},"returns":{"_0":"the compounded liquidity balance of the user on the ERC20 token pool"}},"getUserPoolData(address,address)":{"details":"get user data of the ERC20 token pool","params":{"_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool that need to get the data of the user","_user":"the address of user that need to get the data"},"returns":{"compoundedLiquidityBalance":"- the compounded liquidity balance of this user in this ERC20 token pool, compoundedBorrowBalance - the compounded borrow balance of this user in this ERC20 pool, userUsePoolAsCollateral - the boolean flag that the user uses the liquidity in this ERC20 token pool as collateral or not"}},"initPool(address,address)":{"details":"initialize the ERC20 token pool. only owner can initialize the pool.","params":{"_poolConfig":"the configuration contract of the pool","_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool"}},"isAccountHealthy(address)":{"details":"check is the user account is still healthy Traverse a token list to visit all ERC20 token pools then accumulate 3 balance values of the user: ----------------------------- 1. user's total liquidity balance. Accumulate the user's liquidity balance of all ERC20 token pools 2. user's total borrow balance. Accumulate the user's borrow balance of all ERC20 token pools 3. user's total collateral balance. each ERC20 token has the different max loan-to-value (collateral percent) or the percent of liquidity that can actually use as collateral for the borrowing. e.g. if B token has 75% collateral percent means the collateral balance is 75 if the user's has 100 B token balance ----------------------------- the account is still healthy if total borrow value is less than total collateral value. This means the user's collateral still cover the user's loan. In case of total borrow value is more than total collateral value then user's account is not healthy.","params":{"_user":"the address of the user that will check the account health status"},"returns":{"_0":"the boolean that represent the account health status. Returns true if account is still healthy, false if account is not healthy."}},"liquidate(address,address,uint256,address)":{"details":"liquidate the unhealthy user account","params":{"_collateral":"the ERC20 token of the pool that liquidator will receive as a reward If the user's account health is not healthy, anothor user can become to the liquidator to liquidate the user account then got the collateral as a reward.","_liquidateShares":"the amount of token shares that liquidator want to liquidate","_token":"the token that liquidator whan to liquidate","_user":"the address of the user that liquidator want to liquidate"}},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"receiveAlpha(uint256)":{"details":"implement function of IAlphaReceiver interface to receive Alpha token rewards from the distributor","params":{"_amount":"the amount of Alpha token to receive"}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"repayByAmount(address,uint256)":{"details":"repay the ERC20 token to the pool equal to repay amount","params":{"_amount":"the repay amount User can call this function to repay the ERC20 token to the pool. For user's convenience, this function will convert repay amount to repay shares then do the repay.","_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool that user want to repay"}},"repayByShare(address,uint256)":{"details":"repay the ERC20 token to the pool equal to repay shares","params":{"_share":"the amount of borrow shares thet user want to repay User can call this function to repay the ERC20 token to the pool. This function will do the repay equal to repay shares","_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool that user want to repay"}},"setDistributor(address)":{"details":"set distributor address"},"setPoolConfig(address,address)":{"details":"set pool configuration contract of the pool. only owner can set the pool configuration.","params":{"_poolConfig":"the interface of the pool's configuration contract","_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool that will set the configuration"}},"setPoolStatus(address,uint8)":{"details":"set the status of the lending pool. only owner can set the pool's status","params":{"_status":"the status of the pool","_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool"}},"setPriceOracle(address)":{"details":"set price oracle of the lending pool. only owner can set the price oracle.","params":{"_oracle":"the price oracle which will get asset price to the lending pool contract"}},"setReservePercent(uint256)":{"details":"set reserve percent for admin","params":{"_reservePercent":"the percent of pool reserve"}},"setUserUseAsCollateral(address,bool)":{"details":"set user uses the ERC20 token as collateral flag","params":{"_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool","_useAsCollateral":"the boolean that represent user use the ERC20 token on the pool as collateral or not"}},"setVestingAlpha(address)":{"details":"set vesting alpha address"},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"withdraw(address,uint256)":{"details":"withdraw the ERC20 token from the pool","params":{"_share":"the alToken amount that user want to withdraw When user withdraw their liquidity shares or alToken, they will receive the ERC20 token from the pool equal to the alHello value. e.g. Bob want to withdraw 10 alHello. If 1 alHello equal to 10 Hello tokens then Bob will receive 100 Hello tokens after withdraw. Bob's alHello will be burned. Note: Bob cannot withdraw his alHello if his account is not healthy which means he uses all of his liquidity as collateral to cover his loan so he cannot withdraw or transfer his alHello.","_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool that user want to withdraw"}},"withdrawReserve(address,uint256)":{"details":"withdraw function for admin to get the reserves","params":{"_amount":"amount to withdraw","_token":"the ERC20 token of the pool to withdraw"}}},"stateVariables":{"alTokenDeployer":{"details":"AltokenDeployer address"},"distributor":{"details":"alpha token address contract."},"pools":{"details":"the mapping from the ERC20 token to the pool struct of that ERC20 token token address => pool"},"priceOracle":{"details":"price oracle of the lending pool contract."},"tokenList":{"details":"list of all tokens on the lending pool contract."},"userPoolData":{"details":"the mapping from user address to the ERC20 token to the user data of that ERC20 token's pool user address => token address => user pool data"},"vestingAlpha":{"details":"VestingAlpha address"}},"title":"Lending pool documentation.text:
@dev check is the user account is still healthy
 Traverse a token list to visit all ERC20 token pools then accumulate 3 balance values of the user:
 -----------------------------
 1. user's total liquidity balance. Accumulate the user's liquidity balance of all ERC20 token pools
 2. user's total borrow balance. Accumulate the user's borrow balance of all ERC20 token pools
 3. user's total collateral balance. each ERC20 token has the different max loan-to-value (collateral percent) or the percent of
 liquidity that can actually use as collateral for the borrowing.
 e.g. if B token has 75% collateral percent means the collateral balance is 75 if the user's has 100 B token balance
 -----------------------------
 the account is still healthy if total borrow value is less than total collateral value. This means the user's collateral
 still cover the user's loan. In case of total borrow value is more than total collateral value then user's account is not healthy.
 @param _user the address of the user that will check the account health status
 @return the boolean that represent the account health status. Returns true if account is still healthy, false if account is not healthy.

documentation.text:
@dev liquidate the unhealthy user account (internal)
 @param _user the address of the user that liquidator want to liquidate
 @param _token the token that liquidator whan to liquidate
 @param _liquidateShares the amount of token shares that liquidator want to liquidate
 @param _collateral the ERC20 token of the pool that liquidator will receive as a reward
 e.g. Alice account is not healthy. Bob saw Alice account then want to liquidate 10 Hello borrow shares of Alice account
 and want to get the Seeyou tokens as the collateral. The steps that will happen is below:
 1. Bob calls the liquidate function with _user is Alice address, _token is Hello token,
 _liquidateShare is 10, _collateral is Seeyou token to liquidate Alice account.
 2. Contract check if Alice account is in an unhealthy state or not. If Alice account is
 still healthy, Bob cannot liquidate this account then this transaction will be revert.
 3. Contract check if the collateral that Bob has requested enable for the liquidation reward both on
 pool enabling and Alice enabling.
 4. Bob can liquidate Alice account if Alice has been borrowing Hello tokens from the pool.
 5. Bob can liquidate from 0 to the max liquidate shares which equal to 50% of Alice's Hello borrow share.
 6. Contract calculates the amount of collateral that Bob will receive as the rewards to convert to
 the amount of Seeyou shares. Seeyou shares is the alSeeyou token.
 7. Bob pays Hello tokens equal to 10 Hello shares. If 1 Hello shares equal to 10 Hello tokens then Bob will
 pay 100 Hello token to the pool
 8. The borrowing shares of the Hello token on Alice account will be decreased. The alSeeyou of Alice will be burned.
 9. Bob will get 105 alSeeyou tokens.
 10. Bob can withdraw the alHello tokens later to get the Hello tokens from the pool.
 Note: Hello and Seeyou are the imaginary ERC20 token.

@dev set reserve percent for admin
 @param _reservePercent the percent of pool reserve

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => mapping(address => struct LendingPool.UserPoolData storage ref))
mapping(address => mapping(address => struct LendingPool.UserPoolData storage ref))

params.borrowShares: the amount of borrow shares which calculated from borrow amount
params.pool: the address of the ERC20 token of the pool
params.user: the address of the user who borrow the ERC20 token from the pool

params.depositAmount: the amount of the ERC20 that deposit to the pool
params.depositShares: the share amount of the ERC20 token which calculated from deposit amount Note: depositShares is the same as number of alphaToken
params.pool: the address of the ERC20 token of the pool
params.user: the address of the user who deposit the ERC20 token to the pool

params.collateral: the address of the ERC20 token that liquidator received as a rewards
params.collateralAmount: the amount of the collateral which calculated from liquidate amount that liquidator want to liquidate
params.collateralShares: the amount of collateral shares which liquidator received from liquidation in from of alToken
params.liquidateAmount: the amount of the ERC20 token that liquidator liquidate for the user
params.liquidateShares: the amount of liquidate shares which calculated from liquidate amount
params.pool: the address of the ERC20 token which is liquidated by liquidator
params.user: the address of the user who is liquidated by liquidator

params.pool: the address of the ERC20 token of the pool
params.poolConfigAddress: the address of the updated pool's configuration contract

params.alTokenAddress: the address of the pool's alToken
params.pool: the address of the ERC20 token of the pool
params.poolConfigAddress: the address of the pool's configuration contract

params.cumulativeBorrowInterest: the borrow interest which accumulated from last update timestamp to now
params.pool: the address of the ERC20 token of the pool
params.totalBorrows: the updated total borrows of the pool. increasing by the cumulative borrow interest.

params.priceOracleAddress: the address of the price oracle

params.pool: the address of the ERC20 token of the pool
params.repayShares: the amount of repay shares which calculated from repay amount
params.user: the address of the user who repay the ERC20 token to the pool

params.pool: the address of the ERC20 token of the pool
the address of the ERC20 token of the pool
params.user: the address of the user who withdraw the ERC20 token from the pool
params.withdrawShares: the amount of withdraw shares which calculated from withdraw amount

borrow(address,uint256).details: borrow the ERC20 token from the pool

params._amount: the borrow amount User can call this function to borrow the ERC20 token from the pool. This function will convert the borrow amount to the borrow shares then accumulate borrow shares of this user of this ERC20 pool then set to user data on that pool state. e.g. Bob borrows 10 Hello tokens from the Hello token pool. if 1 borrow shares of Hello token equals to 5 Hello tokens then the lending contract will set Bob's borrow shares state with 2 borrow shares. Bob will receive 10 Hello tokens.
params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool that user want to borrow

claimAlpha().details: claim Alpha token rewards from all ERC20 token pools and create receipt for caller

deposit(address,uint256).details: deposit the ERC20 token to the pool

params._amount: the deposit amount User can call this function to deposit their ERC20 token to the pool. user will receive the alToken of that ERC20 token which represent the liquidity shares of the user. Providing the liquidity will receive an interest from the the borrower as an incentive. e.g. Alice deposits 10 Hello tokens to the pool. if 1 Hello token shares equals to 2 Hello tokens then Alice will have 5 Hello token shares from 10 Hello tokens depositing. User will receive the liquidity shares in the form of alToken so Alice will have 5 alHello on her wallet for representing her shares.
params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool that user want to deposit

getPool(address).details: get the pool of the ERC20 token

params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool

returns.status: - the pool's status, alTokenAddress - the pool's alToken, poolConfigAddress - the pool's configuration contract, totalBorrows - the pool's total borrows, totalBorrowShares - the pool's total borrow shares, totalLiquidity - the pool's total liquidity, totalAvailableLiquidity - the pool's total available liquidity, lastUpdateTimestamp - the pool's last update timestamp

getTotalAvailableLiquidity(address).details: get total available liquidity in the ERC20 token pool

params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool

returns._0: the balance of the ERC20 token in the pool

getTotalLiquidity(address).details: get total liquidity of the ERC20 token pool

params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool

returns._0: the total liquidity on the lending pool which is the sum of total borrows and available liquidity

params._user: the address of the user to get the account details return totalLiquidityBalanceBase - the value of user's total liquidity, totalCollateralBalanceBase - the value of user's total collateral, totalBorrowBalanceBase - the value of user's total borrow

getUserCompoundedBorrowBalance(address,a.details: get user's compounded borrow balance of the user in the ERC20 token pool

params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool that will get the compounded borrow balance

returns._0: the compounded borrow balance of the user on the ERC20 token pool

getUserCompoundedLiquidityBalance(addres.details: get user's compounded liquidity balance of the user in the ERC20 token pool

params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool that will get the compounded liquidity balance
params._user: the account address of the user

returns._0: the compounded liquidity balance of the user on the ERC20 token pool

getUserPoolData(address,address).details: get user data of the ERC20 token pool

params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool that need to get the data of the user
params._user: the address of user that need to get the data

returns.compoundedLiquidityBalance: - the compounded liquidity balance of this user in this ERC20 token pool, compoundedBorrowBalance - the compounded borrow balance of this user in this ERC20 pool, userUsePoolAsCollateral - the boolean flag that the user uses the liquidity in this ERC20 token pool as collateral or not

initPool(address,address).details: initialize the ERC20 token pool. only owner can initialize the pool.

params._poolConfig: the configuration contract of the pool
params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool

isAccountHealthy(address).details: check is the user account is still healthy Traverse a token list to visit all ERC20 token pools then accumulate 3 balance values of the user: ----------------------------- 1. user's total liquidity balance. Accumulate the user's liquidity balance of all ERC20 token pools 2. user's total borrow balance. Accumulate the user's borrow balance of all ERC20 token pools 3. user's total collateral balance. each ERC20 token has the different max loan-to-value (collateral percent) or the percent of liquidity that can actually use as collateral for the borrowing. e.g. if B token has 75% collateral percent means the collateral balance is 75 if the user's has 100 B token balance ----------------------------- the account is still healthy if total borrow value is less than total collateral value. This means the user's collateral still cover the user's loan. In case of total borrow value is more than total collateral value then user's account is not healthy.

params._user: the address of the user that will check the account health status

returns._0: the boolean that represent the account health status. Returns true if account is still healthy, false if account is not healthy.

params._collateral: the ERC20 token of the pool that liquidator will receive as a reward If the user's account health is not healthy, anothor user can become to the liquidator to liquidate the user account then got the collateral as a reward.
params._liquidateShares: the amount of token shares that liquidator want to liquidate
params._token: the token that liquidator whan to liquidate
params._user: the address of the user that liquidator want to liquidate

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

receiveAlpha(uint256).details: implement function of IAlphaReceiver interface to receive Alpha token rewards from the distributor

params._amount: the amount of Alpha token to receive

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

repayByAmount(address,uint256).details: repay the ERC20 token to the pool equal to repay amount

params._amount: the repay amount User can call this function to repay the ERC20 token to the pool. For user's convenience, this function will convert repay amount to repay shares then do the repay.
params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool that user want to repay

repayByShare(address,uint256).details: repay the ERC20 token to the pool equal to repay shares

params._share: the amount of borrow shares thet user want to repay User can call this function to repay the ERC20 token to the pool. This function will do the repay equal to repay shares
params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool that user want to repay

setPoolConfig(address,address).details: set pool configuration contract of the pool. only owner can set the pool configuration.

params._poolConfig: the interface of the pool's configuration contract
params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool that will set the configuration

setPoolStatus(address,uint8).details: set the status of the lending pool. only owner can set the pool's status

params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool

setPriceOracle(address).details: set price oracle of the lending pool. only owner can set the price oracle.

params._oracle: the price oracle which will get asset price to the lending pool contract

setUserUseAsCollateral(address,bool).details: set user uses the ERC20 token as collateral flag

params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool
params._useAsCollateral: the boolean that represent user use the ERC20 token on the pool as collateral or not

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

withdraw(address,uint256).details: withdraw the ERC20 token from the pool

params._share: the alToken amount that user want to withdraw When user withdraw their liquidity shares or alToken, they will receive the ERC20 token from the pool equal to the alHello value. e.g. Bob want to withdraw 10 alHello. If 1 alHello equal to 10 Hello tokens then Bob will receive 100 Hello tokens after withdraw. Bob's alHello will be burned. Note: Bob cannot withdraw his alHello if his account is not healthy which means he uses all of his liquidity as collateral to cover his loan so he cannot withdraw or transfer his alHello.
params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool that user want to withdraw

withdrawReserve(address,uint256).details: withdraw function for admin to get the reserves

params._token: the ERC20 token of the pool to withdraw

pools.details: the mapping from the ERC20 token to the pool struct of that ERC20 token token address => pool

priceOracle.details: price oracle of the lending pool contract.

tokenList.details: list of all tokens on the lending pool contract.

userPoolData.details: the mapping from user address to the ERC20 token to the user data of that ERC20 token's pool user address => token address => user pool data

userdoc.notice: Implements the core contract of lending pool. this contract manages all states and handles user interaction with the pool.
